授業方法:
*The format, schedule, and number of graded assignments or activities may change during the semester depending on student needs, interests, and numbers 

One focus of this class will develop students' speaking and listening through doing debates. Students will be gradually introduced to the language and skills needed for debate, and will take part in practice debates.

A second focus of the class will be conversation. Students will be gradually introduced to the strategies for engaging in free dialogues, and will take part in extensive practice.

 Students will engage in active learning: working individually, in pairs, groups and as a whole class to debate global issues, developing cross-cultural awareness, and improve academic and language skills. The class will be conducted face-to-face. Assignments/homework/assessments will be conducted, and lesson information/resources provided, on Google Classroom. As such, students will need access to a computer at home. BYOD to class is recommended. Students will also need a notebook for notetaking and for creating their own debate 'textbook'

トピック.授業外学習2:
- For all class periods you will be required to complete homework assignments. This may include reading or research, vocabulary study, and debate or conversation preparation. Be sure to attempt these assignments as they reinforce language, skills and assess knowledge of content covered in class. You should review each lesson, and check any new content, language or skills learned.
- You should expect to spend at least 1 hour a week doing homework, but this may be longer around assessments or debates.
- Do not hesitate to contact me if you need any help, I’m happy to speak to you.

評価.教科書Required texts0:
There is no textbook required for this course, the instructor will provide all necessary materials.

However, students will need to purchase a large notebook for creating their own debate textbook with assigned materials + space for note-taking. You will be assessed on this as part of the 'debate performance' section of your grade.
